<html lang="en-US">
<head>
	    
    <script type="text/javascript">
    function gnca_get_location_from_geo_data( geo_data ) {

    	var loc_url = document.location.href.toLowerCase();
    	if( loc_url.indexOf('gref=') > -1 ) {
    		if( loc_url.indexOf( 'gref=am980' ) > -1 ) {
    			return 'gnca-london';
    		} else if( loc_url.indexOf( 'gref=900chml' ) > -1 ) {
    			return 'gnca-hamilton';
    		} else if( loc_url.indexOf( 'gref=channel12' ) > -1 ) {
    			return 'gnca-durham';
    		} else if( loc_url.indexOf( 'gref=chextv' ) > -1 ) {
    			return 'gnca-peterborough';
    		} else if( loc_url.indexOf( 'gref=ckwstv' ) > -1 ) {
    			return 'gnca-kingston';
    		}
    	}

    	// Handle regions that are "misnamed". For instance, the province of Ontario is in the "Toronto" region.
    	if( geo_data.region ) {
    		geo_data.region = geo_data.region.toUpperCase();
    	} else {
    		return false;
    	}
    	switch (geo_data.region) {
    		case 'ONTARIO':
    			if( geo_data.city ) {
    				var city = geo_data.city.toUpperCase();
    				if( 'LONDON' === city || 'WOODSTOCK' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-london';
    				} else if( 'GUELPH' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-guelph';
    				} else if( 'HAMILTON' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-hamilton';
    				} else if( 'PETERBOROUGH' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-peterborough';
    				} else if( 'KINGSTON' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-kingston';
    				} else if( (['AJAX','BROCK', 'CLARINGTON','OSHAWA','PICKERING','SCUGOG','UXBRIDGE','WHITBY']).indexOf(city) > -1 ) {
    					return 'gnca-durham';
    				} else if( (['BARRIE', 'COLLINGWOOD', 'ORILLIA', 'NEWMARKET', 'INNISFIL', 'WASAGA BEACH']).indexOf(city) > -1 ) {
    					return 'gnca-barrie';
    				} else if( 'KITCHENER' === city || 'WATERLOO' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-kitchener';
    				}
    			}

    			if ( geo_data.longitude < -76.232 ) {
    			return 'gnca-toronto';
    			} else {
    				return 'gnca-ottawa';
    			}

    		case 'QUEBEC':
    			if( geo_data.city ) {
    				var city = geo_data.city.toUpperCase();
    				if( 'GATINEAU' === city ) {
    					return 'gnca-ottawa';
    				}
    			}

    			return 'gnca-montreal';

    		case 'MANITOBA':
    			return 'gnca-winnipeg';

    		// If in one of the maritime regions, handle that now
    		case 'NOVA SCOTIA':
    			return 'gnca-halifax';

    		case 'NEW BRUNSWICK':
    			return 'gnca-new-brunswick';
    	}

    	// If geo_data is not set properly, no more explorations of the location can be done.
    	if ( 'undefined' === typeof( geo_data.latitude ) || 'undefined' === typeof( geo_data.longitude ) ) {
    		return false;
    	}

    	/**
    	* Handle provinces with multiple regions. These are determined by first look at the region that the was identified.
    	* Next, the latitude or longitude is investigated to determine which region within the province the is appropriate.
    	*/
    	if ( 'BRITISH COLUMBIA' === geo_data.region ) {
    		if ( geo_data.longitude > -121.000 ) {
    			return 'gnca-okanagan';
    		} else {
    			return 'gnca-bc';
    		}
    	}

    	/**
    	* There are 3 regions in Alberta. To simplify the logic, the function checks for the bottom most, then the top most
    	* region. If it is not the top or bottom most region, it is assumed to be the middle region.
    	*/
    	if ( 'ALBERTA' === geo_data.region ) {
    		if ( geo_data.latitude > 52.145 ) {     // Demarcation of bottom and middle region
    			return 'gnca-edmonton';
    		} else if ( geo_data.latitude < 50.222 ) { // Demarcation of top and middle region
    			return 'gnca-lethbridge';
    		} else {
    			return 'gnca-calgary';
    		}
    	}

    	if ( 'SASKATCHEWAN' === geo_data.region ) {
    		if ( geo_data.latitude < 51.212 ) {
    			return 'gnca-regina';
    		} else {
    			return 'gnca-saskatoon';
    		}
    	}

    	return false;
    }
    </script>
    <script type="text/javascript">
        function geoSetCookie(cname, cvalue, exdays) {
            var d = new Date();
            d.setTime(d.getTime() + (exdays*24*60*60*1000));
            var expires = "expires="+ d.toUTCString();
            document.cookie = cname + "=" + cvalue + ";" + expires + ";path=/";
        }

        function geoGetCookie(cname, cvalue, exdays) {
            var name = cname + "=";
            var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
            var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
            for (var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
                var c = ca[i];
                while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
                    c = c.substring(1);
                }
                if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
                    return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
                }
            }
            return "";
        }

        var cookieName = 'gncaGeoDetected';
        var geoDetected = geoGetCookie( cookieName );

        console.log( 'geo detected?', geoDetected );

        // Ensure geo detection only takes place once.
        if ( ! geoDetected ) {
            // Save a cookie to remember the geo detection attempt.
            geoSetCookie( cookieName, geoDetected + 1, 1 );

            console.log( 'set geoDetected' );

            // Timeout geo detection request to ensure the cookie is set.
            setTimeout( function() {
                // detect region
                var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
                xhr.open( 'GET', 'https://public-api.wordpress.com/geo/', false );
                xhr.onreadystatechange = function() {
                    // Call a function when the state changes.
                    if ( this.readyState === XMLHttpRequest.DONE && this.status === 200 ) {
                        var geo = JSON.parse( this.responseText );
                        var region = gnca_get_location_from_geo_data( geo );
                        if ( ! region ) {
                            region = 'gnca-national';
                        }
                        var xhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();
                        xhttp.open( 'POST', '/gnca-ajax/blank', false );
                        xhttp.setRequestHeader( 'Content-type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' );
                        xhttp.onreadystatechange = function() { // Call a function when the state changes.
                            if ( this.readyState === XMLHttpRequest.DONE && this.status === 200 ) {
                               window.location.reload();
                            }
                        };
                        xhttp.send( 'gnca-region=' + region );
                    }
                };
                xhr.send('');
            }, 500 );
        }
    </script>

				<article class="l-article__text js-story-text" aria-label="Article text">
					<p>After more than five decades, humans are getting closer to returning to the <a href="https://globalnews.ca/tag/moon-mission/">moon.</a></p><img src="https://d21y75miwcfqoq.cloudfront.net/70c8fc80" style="position:absolute;width:1px;height:1px" referrerpolicy="no-referrer-when-downgrade">
<p><a href="https://globalnews.ca/tag/nasa/">NASA</a> is planning to send four astronauts, including Canadian Jeremy Hansen, around the moon with the launch of the <a href="https://globalnews.ca/tag/artemis-2/">Artemis II</a> mission set for next year.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="readmore">		<p class="c-readmore" data-sophi-feature="article-science" data-gnca-ab-test="article-science" data-gnca-ab-variation="control">
			<span class="c-readmore__label">Read more: </span>
			<a class="c-readmore__link" href="https://globalnews.ca/news/9597656/artemis-ii-astronauts-named-jeremy-hansen/" data-track-region="content-read-more" title="Canadian Jeremy Hansen named to NASA’s Artemis II mission around the moon">
			Canadian Jeremy Hansen named to NASA’s Artemis II mission around the moon			</a>
		</p>

	</div><p>In preparation for that, on Monday, the U.S space agency and <a href="https://globalnews.ca/tag/canadian-space-agency/">Canadian Space Agency</a> (CSA) will be <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-canadian-space-agency-to-assign-artemis-ii-moon-astronauts" target="_blank" rel="noopener">announcing the four-person crew</a> that will venture around the moon and back.</p><p>Monday’s event will be held at the NASA Johnson Space Center’s Ellington Field in Houston.</p><p>Canada’s Industry Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne <a href="https://www.canada.ca/en/innovation-science-economic-development/news/2023/03/minister-champagne-to-announce-the-canadian-space-agency-astronaut-who-will-fly-around-the-moon.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">will be in attendance</a> along with the CSA’s vice president, Mary Preville.</p>		<div class="c-ad c-ad--bigbox l-article__ad">							<div class="c-ad__label">Story continues below advertisement</div>
			
			
			<div id="gpt-ad-300250-10" class="c-ad__unit" data-ad-pos="10">
			</div>

					<script>
					if ( typeof( gn_monetize ) !== 'undefined' && typeof( gn_monetize.Ads ) !== 'undefined' && gn_monetize.Ads.initialRequestMade() ) {
						// Ads script has been loaded, create the ad.
						gn_monetize.Ads.create( {"sizes":"[300,250]","biddable":true,"id":"gpt-ad-300250-10","lazy":false,"targeting":{"pos":10,"slotid":"gpt-ad-300250-10"},"companion":false} );
					} else {
						// if Ads script not yet loaded, queue up ad data for initialization.
						var gnAdSettings = gnAdSettings || {};
						gnAdSettings.ads = gnAdSettings.ads || [];
						gnAdSettings.ads.push( {"sizes":"[300,250]","biddable":true,"id":"gpt-ad-300250-10","lazy":false,"targeting":{"pos":10,"slotid":"gpt-ad-300250-10"},"companion":false} );
						}
				</script>
		</div>	<div class="l-article__oembed embed-twitter"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="500" data-dnt="true"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">On April 3, you will meet the team of astronauts flying to the Moon on the <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Artemis?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#Artemis</a> II mission.</p><p>These explorers will pave the way for future lunar landings and our next giant leap — human exploration of Mars. <a href="https://t.co/PRlRVEsJVz">https://t.co/PRlRVEsJVz</a> <a href="https://t.co/BBlyhVJZNV">pic.twitter.com/BBlyhVJZNV</a></p><p>— NASA (@NASA) <a href="https://twitter.com/NASA/status/1640814001348067328?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">March 28, 2023</a></p></blockquote></div><p><script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script></p><p>“The approximately 10-day flight test will pave the way for lunar surface missions, including landing the first woman and first person of color on the Moon,” <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/artemis-ii" target="_blank" rel="noopener">NASA says on its website.</a></p><p>If successful, this will be the first time humans get that close to the moon since the Apollo program more than 50 years ago.</p><p>And for the first time, there will be Canadian representation, with a CSA astronaut among the Artemis II crew.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="readmore">		<p class="c-readmore" data-sophi-feature="article-science" data-gnca-ab-test="article-science" data-gnca-ab-variation="control">
			<span class="c-readmore__label">Read more: </span>
			<a class="c-readmore__link" href="https://globalnews.ca/news/9456973/protecting-earth-asteroid/" data-track-region="content-read-more" title="Can we stop an asteroid from hitting Earth?">
			Can we stop an asteroid from hitting Earth?			</a>
		</p>

	</div><p>Chris Hadfield, a retired Canadian astronaut, called it a “historic” moment.</p>		<div class="c-ad c-ad--bigbox l-article__ad">							<div class="c-ad__label">Story continues below advertisement</div>
			
			
			<div id="gpt-ad-300250-11" class="c-ad__unit" data-ad-pos="11" loading="lazy">
			</div>

						}
				</script>
		</div>	<p>“It’s just opening the door for all the things that are going to follow – an exploration of the moon and the solar system beyond,” he told Global News in an interview Sunday.</p><p>Hadfield helped pick the four astronauts for Artemis II.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="tp_video">			    	<div class="c-video c-videoPlay " data-iframe-receiver data-autoplay="" data-displayinline-featured="false" data-displayinline-type="video" data-displayinline-player-id="miniplayer_9553587_642d771b0dd36" data-displayinline-video-id="9553587" data-displayinline-ratio="16:9" data-displayinline="https://globalnews.ca/video/embed/9553587/#autoplay&stickyiframe=miniplayer_9553587_642d771b0dd36" data-displayinline-sticky="true">

						<img class="c-video__image" alt="Click to play video: 'NASA, Axiom Space unveil new spacesuit for Artemis III moon mission'" width="640" height="360" data-src="https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/xon1q3mrzq-uvqajhocu4/WE_NASA_SPACE_SUIT_VMS.jpg?w=1040&quality=70&strip=all" loading="lazy" srcset="" sizes="" data-srcset="https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/xon1q3mrzq-uvqajhocu4/WE_NASA_SPACE_SUIT_VMS.jpg?w=450#038;quality=70&strip=all 450w,https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/xon1q3mrzq-uvqajhocu4/WE_NASA_SPACE_SUIT_VMS.jpg?w=720#038;quality=70&strip=all 720w,https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/xon1q3mrzq-uvqajhocu4/WE_NASA_SPACE_SUIT_VMS.jpg?w=1040#038;quality=70&strip=all 1040w," data-sizes="(min-width: 1040px) 1040px,(min-width: 720px) 720px,450px">
												<span class="c-video__overlay">
							<div class="c-button c-video__icon c-videoPlay__icon c-button--mini">
		<svg class="c-icon  c-button__icon" focusable="false">
		<use xlink:href="https://globalnews.ca/wp-content/themes/shaw-globalnews/assets/dist/icons/out/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=3knoi0mr1#play"></use>
	</svg>
	</div>
							<div class="c-video__data">
																	<time class="c-video__duration">4:25</time>
																									<span class="c-video__title">NASA, Axiom Space unveil new spacesuit for Artemis III moon mission</span>
															</div>
						</span>
											</span>
				</div>
							</div>
				</div><p>While he didn’t give away any names ahead of the announcement, Hadfield said the chosen crew has deep technical competence and a real burning desire for the mission among other qualities.</p><p>“They’re going to have to take a tremendous risk to climb onboard that enormous rocket ship that’s only ever flown once in history and take that little spaceship all the way around the moon and back,” he said.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="tp_video">			    	<div class="c-video c-videoPlay " data-iframe-receiver data-autoplay="" data-displayinline-featured="false" data-displayinline-type="video" data-displayinline-player-id="miniplayer_9577784_642d771b0e311" data-displayinline-video-id="9577784" data-displayinline-ratio="16:9" data-displayinline="https://globalnews.ca/video/embed/9577784/#autoplay&stickyiframe=miniplayer_9577784_642d771b0e311" data-displayinline-sticky="true">
				<div class="c-video__inner">
					<span class="c-video__placeholder">
						<img class="c-video__image" alt="Click to play video: 'Biden says Canadian will fly on Artemis II mission: ‘Canada and the U.S. can do big things together’'" width="640" height="360" data-src="https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/7deg3cyi7m-3eupktiu3b/ONLINE_STILL_BIDEN_ARTEMIS.jpg?w=1040&quality=70&strip=all" loading="lazy" srcset="" sizes="" data-srcset="https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/7deg3cyi7m-3eupktiu3b/ONLINE_STILL_BIDEN_ARTEMIS.jpg?w=450#038;quality=70&strip=all 450w,https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/7deg3cyi7m-3eupktiu3b/ONLINE_STILL_BIDEN_ARTEMIS.jpg?w=720#038;quality=70&strip=all 720w,https://i1.wp.com/media.globalnews.ca/videostatic/news/7deg3cyi7m-3eupktiu3b/ONLINE_STILL_BIDEN_ARTEMIS.jpg?w=1040#038;quality=70&strip=all 1040w," data-sizes="(min-width: 1040px) 1040px,(min-width: 720px) 720px,450px">
												<span class="c-video__overlay">

		<svg class="c-icon  c-button__icon" focusable="false">

															</div>
						</span>
											</span>
				</div>
							</div>
				</div><p>So far, 24 men — all Americans — have visited the moon and half of those have walked on it.</p>		<div class="c-ad c-ad--bigbox l-article__ad">							<div class="c-ad__label">Story continues below advertisement</div>

						}
				</script>
		</div>	<p>The first to set foot were Neil Armstrong and Edwin “Buzz” Aldrin in 1969.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="section-heading">	<div class="l-article__sectionHeading c-sectionHeading ">
				<span class="l-article__sectionAnchor c-sectionHeading__anchor" id="what-is-artemis-ii"></span>
						<h2 class="c-sectionHeading__title">
				What is Artemis II?			</h2>
						</div>
	</div><p>The launch of Artemis II is scheduled for November 2024.</p>	<section id="content-dynamic-trending-stories" class="l-inlineStories l-inlineStories--tile u-hide-tablet-landscape" aria-label="Dynamic trending stories section">

						<div class="c-posts__details">

						<div class="c-posts__details">

	</div>

	<p>Four astronauts will travel onboard NASA’s Orion spacecraft.</p><p>The mission around the moon and back will take approximately 10 days. The return trip alone will take about four days.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="readmore">		<p class="c-readmore" data-sophi-feature="article-science" data-gnca-ab-test="article-science" data-gnca-ab-variation="control">
			<span class="c-readmore__label">Read more: </span>
			<a class="c-readmore__link" href="https://globalnews.ca/news/9090659/artemis-space-mission-moon-mars/" data-track-region="content-read-more" title="Artemis space mission to moon considered ‘a stepping stone’ to Mars">
			Artemis space mission to moon considered ‘a stepping stone’ to Mars			</a>
		</p>

	</div><p>Artemis II is “the first crewed flight test on the agency’s path to establishing a long-term scientific and human presence on the lunar surface,” <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-canadian-space-agency-to-assign-artemis-ii-moon-astronauts" target="_blank" rel="noopener">according to NASA.</a></p><p>This builds on the success of <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/specials/artemis-i/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Artemis I</a>, an unmanned flight, that travelled on a 1.4 million-mile journey beyond the moon, returning <a href="https://globalnews.ca/news/9341046/nasas-orion-capsule/">to Earth after 25 days</a> last December.</p>		<div class="c-ad c-ad--bigbox l-article__ad">							<div class="c-ad__label">Story continues below advertisement</div>

						}
				</script>
		</div>	<p>That mission took place to ensure safe re-entry, descent, splashdown, and recovery using the new Orion spacecraft so NASA is ready for Artemis II when a crew is onboard.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="tp_video">			    	<div class="c-video c-videoPlay " data-iframe-receiver data-autoplay="" data-displayinline-featured="false" data-displayinline-type="video" data-displayinline-player-id="miniplayer_9327766_642d771b10268" data-displayinline-video-id="9327766" data-displayinline-ratio="16:9" data-displayinline="https://globalnews.ca/video/embed/9327766/#autoplay&stickyiframe=miniplayer_9327766_642d771b10268" data-displayinline-sticky="true">

		<svg class="c-icon  c-button__icon" focusable="false">
		<use xlink:href="https://globalnews.ca/wp-content/themes/shaw-globalnews/assets/dist/icons/out/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg?v=3knoi0mr1#play"></use>

											</span>

							</div>
				</div><p>While the space agency plans to send four astronauts around the moon in 2024, it wants to attempt a two-person lunar landing as early as 2025, with the launch of Artemis III.</p><p>Astronauts last visited the moon in December 1972, closing out the Apollo program.</p><div class="l-article__part" data-shortcode="caption">

</figure>
</div><p>With the Artemis missions, NASA aims to “explore more of the lunar surface than ever before” and build a <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/artemisprogram" target="_blank" rel="noopener">“sustainable presence on the Moon.”</a></p>		<div class="c-ad c-ad--bigbox l-article__ad">							<div class="c-ad__label">Story continues below advertisement</div>

						}
				</script>
		</div>	<p>The end goal is to go to Mars by the late 2030s.</p><p>“We will collaborate with commercial and international partners and establish the first long-term presence on the Moon,” <a href="https://www.nasa.gov/specials/artemis/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">NASA says.</a></p><p>“Then, we will use what we learn on and around the Moon to take the next giant leap: sending the first astronauts to Mars.”</p><p><em>— with files from the Associated Press. </em></p>	<section id="sophi_article_widget" class="l-inlineStories l-inlineStories--text " aria-label="More on Science and Tech" data-sophi-feature="article-science" data-gnca-ab-test="article-science" data-gnca-ab-variation="test">

main.headline: Artemis II: Why NASA is sending a crew around the moon after 50 years
main.description: Back to the moon? Not quite, but close. Here's what NASA wants from the lunar orbit program known as Artemis II and why a Canadian will be on board.

image.caption: The Earth and its moon are seen from NASA's Orion spacecraft on Monday, Nov. 28, 2022. Orion and its three test dummies entered lunar orbit on Friday, Nov. 25, more than a week after launching on the first flight of the Artemis program. The spacecraft was expected to reach a maximum distance of almost 270,000 from Earth on Monday.

title: Artemis II: Why NASA is sending a crew around the moon after 50 years
description: Back to the moon? Not quite, but close. Here's what NASA wants from the lunar orbit program known as Artemis II and why a Canadian will be on board.
text:
Want to discuss? Please read our   first. After more than five decades, humans are getting closer to returning to the   is planning to send four astronauts, including Canadian Jeremy Hansen, around the moon with the launch of the   mission set for next year. 
			 
			 
		 In preparation for that, on Monday, the U.S space agency and   (CSA) will be   that will venture around the moon and back. Monday’s event will be held at the NASA Johnson Space Center’s Ellington Field in Houston. Canada’s Industry Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne   along with the CSA’s vice president, Mary Preville. On April 3, you will meet the team of astronauts flying to the Moon on the   II mission. These explorers will pave the way for future lunar landings and our next giant leap — human exploration of Mars.    — NASA (@NASA)  “The approximately 10-day flight test will pave the way for lunar surface missions, including landing the first woman and first person of color on the Moon,”  If successful, this will be the first time humans get that close to the moon since the Apollo program more than 50 years ago. And for the first time, there will be Canadian representation, with a CSA astronaut among the Artemis II crew. 
			 
			 
		 Chris Hadfield, a retired Canadian astronaut, called it a “historic” moment. “It’s just opening the door for all the things that are going to follow – an exploration of the moon and the solar system beyond,” he told Global News in an interview Sunday. Hadfield helped pick the four astronauts for Artemis II. While he didn’t give away any names ahead of the announcement, Hadfield said the chosen crew has deep technical competence and a real burning desire for the mission among other qualities. “They’re going to have to take a tremendous risk to climb onboard that enormous rocket ship that’s only ever flown once in history and take that little spaceship all the way around the moon and back,” he said. So far, 24 men — all Americans — have visited the moon and half of those have walked on it. The first to set foot were Neil Armstrong and Edwin “Buzz” Aldrin in 1969. The launch of Artemis II is scheduled for November 2024. Four astronauts will travel onboard NASA’s Orion spacecraft. The mission around the moon and back will take approximately 10 days. The return trip alone will take about four days. 
			 
			 
		 Artemis II is “the first crewed flight test on the agency’s path to establishing a long-term scientific and human presence on the lunar surface,”  This builds on the success of  , an unmanned flight, that travelled on a 1.4 million-mile journey beyond the moon, returning   last December. That mission took place to ensure safe re-entry, descent, splashdown, and recovery using the new Orion spacecraft so NASA is ready for Artemis II when a crew is onboard. While the space agency plans to send four astronauts around the moon in 2024, it wants to attempt a two-person lunar landing as early as 2025, with the launch of Artemis III. Astronauts last visited the moon in December 1972, closing out the Apollo program. With the Artemis missions, NASA aims to “explore more of the lunar surface than ever before” and build a  The end goal is to go to Mars by the late 2030s. “We will collaborate with commercial and international partners and establish the first long-term presence on the Moon,”  “Then, we will use what we learn on and around the Moon to take the next giant leap: sending the first astronauts to Mars.” Get a roundup of the most important and intriguing national stories delivered to your inbox every weekday. images.caption: NASA’s Orion spacecraft flew past the moon on Monday, December 5, 2022.
